title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 753-4.10 - Unverifiable underground facilities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 753-4.10 - Unverifiable underground facilities

State Regulations

If an excavator notifies an operator that, after diligent
search at a reasonable depth within the tolerance zone as staked, marked or
otherwise designated by the operator, that he or she cannot verify the location
of an underground facility, the operator shall verify such location as soon as
possible or shall provide the excavator with prompt field assistance or use
other means mutually agreed to by the excavator and operator. Such agreement
shall be provided to the excavator upon his or her request. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
§§
753-4.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
